detaileddescription.para: Contains the file as it is. Needs custom decoder function
Contains the file as it is. The image has alpha. Needs custom decoder function
Contains the file as it is. The image is chroma keyed. Needs custom decoder function
Color format and depth should match with LV_COLOR settings
Same as LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR but every pixel has an alpha byte
Same as LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR but LV_COLOR_TRANSP pixels will be transparent
Can have 2 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 4 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 16 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have 256 different colors in a palette (always chroma keyed)
Can have one color and it can be drawn or not
Can have one color but 4 different alpha value
Can have one color but 16 different alpha value
Can have one color but 256 different alpha value
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
Reserved for further use.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.
User holder encoding format.

Allocate an image buffer in RAM
w
width of image
h
height of image
cf
a color format (LV_IMG_CF_...)
an allocated image, or NULL on failure

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_img_dsc_t *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_color_t color)
memberdef.name: lv_img_buf_get_px_color

detaileddescription.para:
Get the color of an image's pixel
dsc
an image descriptor
x
x coordinate of the point to get
y
x coordinate of the point to get
color
the color of the image. In case of LV_IMG_CF_ALPHA_1/2/4/8 this color is used. Not used in other cases.
safe
true: check out of bounds
color of the point

Get the alpha value of an image's pixel
dsc
pointer to an image descriptor
x
x coordinate of the point to set
y
x coordinate of the point to set
safe
true: check out of bounds
alpha value of the point

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_img_dsc_t *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_color_t c)
memberdef.name: lv_img_buf_set_px_color

detaileddescription.para:
Set the color of a pixel of an image. The alpha channel won't be affected.
dsc
pointer to an image descriptor
x
x coordinate of the point to set
y
x coordinate of the point to set
c
color of the point
safe
true: check out of bounds

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_img_dsc_t *dsc, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_opa_t opa)
memberdef.name: lv_img_buf_set_px_alpha

detaileddescription.para:
Set the alpha value of a pixel of an image. The color won't be affected
dsc
pointer to an image descriptor
x
x coordinate of the point to set
y
x coordinate of the point to set
opa
the desired opacity
safe
true: check out of bounds

Set the palette color of an indexed image. Valid only for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED1/2/4/8
dsc
pointer to an image descriptor
id
the palette color to set:
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED1: 0..1
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED2: 0..3
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED4: 0..15
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED8: 0..255
c
the color to set

Free an allocated image buffer
dsc
image buffer to free

Get the memory consumption of a raw bitmap, given color format and dimensions.
w
width
h
height
cf
color format
size in bytes

Initialize a descriptor to rotate an image
dsc
pointer to an lv_img_transform_dsc_t variable whose cfg field is initialized

Get which color and opa would come to a pixel if it were rotated
dsc
a descriptor initialized by lv_img_buf_rotate_init
x
the coordinate which color and opa should be get
y
the coordinate which color and opa should be get
true: there is valid pixel on these x/y coordinates; false: the rotated pixel was out of the image
the result is written back to dsc->res_color and dsc->res_opa

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_area_t *res, lv_coord_t w, lv_coord_t h, int16_t angle, uint16_t zoom, lv_point_t *pivot)
memberdef.name: lv_img_buf_get_transformed_area

detaileddescription.para:
Get the area of a rectangle if its rotated and scaled
res
store the coordinates here
w
width of the rectangle to transform
h
height of the rectangle to transform
angle
angle of rotation
zoom
zoom, (256 no zoom)
pivot
x,y pivot coordinates of rotation
